description: A massive gladiatorial arena in the heart of Dressrosa, where fierce battles and tournaments are held for public entertainment. The Corrida Colosseum is a legendary fighting venue with a long history and attracts warriors from across the world.

keyEvents.title: Thunder Soldier at the Colosseum
keyEvents.description: The Thunder Soldier appears outside the Corrida Colosseum, warning children to stay away from the brutal arena before being chased by guards.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the Colosseum as a dangerous and significant location in Dressrosa.

keyEvents.title: Luffy and Franky Arrive
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Franky reach the Corrida Colosseum after learning about the tournament from interrogated thugs.
keyEvents.significance: Brings the protagonists to the central location for much of the Dressrosa Arc.

keyEvents.title: Tournament Opening Ceremony
keyEvents.description: Gatz opens the tournament ceremony, introducing the Corrida Colosseum to the audience and setting the stage for the battles to come.
keyEvents.significance: Officially begins the tournament arc that will span many episodes.

keyEvents.title: Mera Mera no Mi Revealed
keyEvents.description: The Mera Mera no Mi is unveiled as the grand prize of the tournament at the opening ceremony, shocking the audience.
keyEvents.significance: This revelation transforms the tournament from a simple gladiatorial contest into a pivotal event with major implications for Luffy and the story.

description: A vibrant kingdom in the New World known as the 'Country of Love, Passion and Toys'. Ruled by Donquixote Doflamingo, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, Dressrosa appears to be a paradise but hides dark secrets beneath its colorful surface.

keyEvents.title: Issho Appears in Dressrosa
keyEvents.description: The blind man Issho is first seen at a roulette table in Dressrosa, being cheated by local thugs.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces a major character within the kingdom of Dressrosa.

keyEvents.title: Fairy Thefts in Dressrosa
keyEvents.description: Invisible 'fairies' steal belongings throughout Dressrosa, with the toy citizens explaining this is normal and accepted.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals one of Dressrosa's many mysteries and hints at the deeper secrets of the kingdom.
